description:
## Overview
Break the game specification into a structured set of epics and issues that Ralph can work through.

## What To Do

1. **Read the spec** at docs/specs/game-spec.md thoroughly

2. **Create epics** for each major feature area:
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Core Game Engine" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Weapons System" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "AI Opponents" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Visual Effects" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Audio System" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "UI/Menus" ...`
   - etc.

3. **Break each epic into small, focused issues:**
   - Each issue = ONE thing Ralph can do in ONE iteration
   - Too big? Split it. "Implement all weapons" → one issue per weapon
   - Example issues under Core Game Engine:
     - "Create game loop and state machine"
     - "Implement turn system"
     - "Add projectile trajectory calculation"
     - "Implement terrain heightmap data structure"
     - "Add terrain rendering"
     - "Implement collision detection"
     - "Add terrain destruction"

4. **CRITICAL: Set dependencies correctly:**
   - ALL implementation issues must include: `--deps "blocks:scorched-earth-7ku"`
   - This ensures tech stack is done first
   - Also set logical dependencies (terrain rendering blocks terrain destruction)

5. **Write good acceptance criteria for EACH issue:**
   ```bash
   bd create --title "Implement basic projectile physics" \
     --type task \
     --parent <epic-id> \
     --deps "blocks:scorched-earth-7ku" \
     --acceptance "## Acceptance Criteria
   - [ ] Projectile spawns at tank barrel position
   - [ ] Follows parabolic arc based on angle and power
   - [ ] Affected by gravity constant
   - [ ] Affected by wind value
   - [ ] Trajectory visually matches expected physics
   - [ ] Console shows no errors"
   ```

6. **Prioritize logically:**
   - Foundation first (game loop, rendering, physics)
   - Then features (weapons, AI)
   - Then polish (effects, audio, UI)

7. **Document the structure** - Update CLAUDE.md "Current Status" section with the epic breakdown

## What To Do

1. **Read the research document** at docs/research/scorched-earth-original.md thoroughly

2. **Create the spec document** at docs/specs/game-spec.md with these sections:

### Core Gameplay
- Turn structure (player turn → AI turn → repeat)
- Win/lose conditions
- Round progression
- How damage is calculated

### Controls & Input
- Aiming mechanism (angle: 0-180°, power: 0-100%)
- Touch input mapping for mobile (drag to aim, release to fire)
- Keyboard fallbacks for desktop

### Physics System
- Projectile motion equations (gravity, initial velocity, wind)
- Wind behavior (constant per round? variable?)
- Collision detection with terrain
- Terrain destruction radius calculations

### Weapons
For EACH weapon, define:
- Name, cost, ammo limit
- Damage value and blast radius
- Special behavior (MIRV splits, Roller rolls, Digger burrows)
- Visual effect type

### Terrain System
- Generation algorithm (midpoint displacement? perlin noise?)
- Destruction mechanics (how craters form)
- Dirt falling physics (how displaced terrain settles)
- Terrain data structure (heightmap array)

### Economy & Progression
- Starting money
- Money earned per hit/kill/win
- Shop items and prices
- Round difficulty scaling

### AI Opponents
- Difficulty tiers (Easy, Medium, Hard)
- How AI calculates shots
- AI weapon selection logic

### Visual Design (Synthwave)
- Color palette (neons, dark backgrounds, grid lines)
- Tank designs
- Explosion effects
- UI style
- Background layers (sunset gradient, grid, mountains)

### Audio Design
- Music style (synthwave, 80s)

## Implementation Summary

Implemented a fixed timestep game loop pattern that separates physics updates from rendering. This ensures consistent physics behavior regardless of actual frame rate.

- Added accumulator-based fixed timestep pattern (~16.67ms physics updates)
- Added `pauseLoop()` and `resumeLoop()` functions for proper game pausing
- Added max accumulated time cap to prevent 'spiral of death'
- Physics updates run in a while loop consuming accumulated time in fixed chunks
- Rendering happens once per frame after all physics updates

- Fixed timestep prevents jitter by decoupling physics from variable frame times

## Implementation Summary

Created a comprehensive input abstraction layer that provides high-level game input events on top of the existing low-level mouse/touch/keyboard handling.

   - Events are queued via queueGameInput()

5. **Phase-Based Enable/Disable**:

- [ ] Neon glow effect on tank edges
- [ ] Tank renders at correct position on terrain
- [ ] Angle 0 = turret points right, 90 = up, 180 = left
- [ ] When sprite assets available, renders sprites instead

title: Implement Projectile Physics
description: Create projectile with ballistic physics: gravity, wind effect, velocity from angle/power.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Projectile class with x, y, vx, vy properties
- [ ] Spawns at tank barrel position based on angle
- [ ] Initial velocity from power (0-100% maps to 0-20 px/frame)
- [ ] Velocity direction from angle
- [ ] Gravity constant (0.15 px/frame²) pulls projectile down
- [ ] Wind value affects horizontal velocity each frame
- [ ] update() method advances position
- [ ] Trajectory follows realistic parabolic arc

title: Implement Projectile Rendering
description: Render projectile on canvas with trail effect for visual feedback.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Projectile renders as glowing circle (8px diameter)
- [ ] Color: bright yellow/white (#f9f002)
- [ ] Trail effect: fading circles behind projectile
- [ ] Trail length: 5-10 positions
- [ ] Trail fades from bright to transparent
- [ ] Rendering works at any position on canvas
- [ ] Clean up trail when projectile destroyed

title: Implement Terrain Collision Detection
description: Detect when projectile collides with terrain using heightmap lookup.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] checkTerrainCollision(x, y) returns hit info
- [ ] Collision when y >= terrain[x] (projectile at or below ground)
- [ ] Returns collision point (x, y)
- [ ] Handles projectiles outside terrain bounds (off-screen)
- [ ] Sub-pixel accuracy not required (integer positions OK)
- [ ] Collision check runs each physics frame
- [ ] No false positives at terrain edges

title: Implement Tank Collision Detection
description: Detect when projectile collides with a tank using rectangular hitbox.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] checkTankCollision(x, y, tanks) returns hit tank or null
- [ ] Tank hitbox is rectangular (64x32 centered on tank position)
- [ ] Direct hit flag if projectile center within 5px of tank center
- [ ] Check both player and enemy tanks
- [ ] Collision returns which tank was hit
- [ ] Works correctly when tanks overlap (edge case)
- [ ] No collision with already-destroyed tanks

title: Implement Damage Calculation
description: Calculate damage to tanks based on explosion proximity with distance falloff.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] calculateDamage(explosion, tank, weapon) returns damage amount
- [ ] Damage based on distance from explosion center
- [ ] Linear falloff: damage = maxDamage * (1 - distance/blastRadius)
- [ ] Zero damage outside blast radius
- [ ] 1.5x multiplier for direct hits (distance < 5px)
- [ ] Damage applied to tank health
- [ ] Console logs damage dealt in debug mode

title: Implement Wind System
description: Add wind that affects projectile trajectory, randomized each round.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Wind value range: -10 to +10
- [ ] Negative = blowing left, Positive = blowing right
- [ ] New random wind value each round
- [ ] Wind affects projectile horizontal velocity each frame
- [ ] Wind indicator UI shows direction and strength
- [ ] Wind visually represented (arrow with variable size)
- [ ] Projectile trajectory visibly affected by wind

title: Economy and Shop
description:

Money system and weapon shop between rounds for progression.

title: Implement Money System
description: Track player money, award based on damage dealt and round outcome.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Player starts with

- [ ] Money persists across rounds

title: Create Shop UI
description: Build weapon shop interface showing all weapons with prices and purchase buttons.
acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] Shows all weapons organized by category

title: Implement Weapon Purchasing
description: Allow player to buy weapons, deduct money, add to inventory.
acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] Each purchase adds weapon's ammo amount

- [ ] Purchase sound effect plays

title: Implement Player Inventory
description: Track player's weapon inventory with ammo counts.

title: Implement Round Progression
description: Progress through rounds with increasing difficulty and bonus multipliers.
acceptance_criteria:
